ygData.subject: Re: CHAR vs WIS vs INT .......STOP THE INSANIT Y!!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, the problem is, we cant document any pattern between those who complain they always get resisted and those who dont.  well, except for 3 level higher
ygData.messageBody:
Well, the problem is, we cant document any pattern between those who
complain they always get resisted and those who dont. well, except for
3 level higher reds, who resist all of us. And yes, much of the
information on Stratics is crap, as well as EQvault. Much is also very
good, but im not going to say there arent undocumented features just
cause Eqvault says so.


-----Original Message-----
From: Ernest Dotson [mailto:ewd5330@...]
Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 1:29 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: CHAR vs WIS vs INT .......STOP THE
INSANITY!!!!


From: "Ernest Dotson" <ewd5330@...>


>From: "Magik" <aarongb@...>
>
>well I hate to agree with sumone that is so definate but.......
>
> I have been playing since beta4 and have freinds that have been
in
>since phase 3......even Stratics and the EQVault (which are authored by
beta
>testers!!!) tell us that charisma is the direct effect of merchant
>sales.......the debates you are talking about are obviously on webpages
that
>are NEWER or are made by ppl who are just lrearning the game and are
made
>based on assumtions of ingame actions......if you read EQSS and find
out
>what they say....... I quote straigth from the ATTRIBUTE section on the
left
>hand side of the website......this is cut and copied for all you NON
>belivers!!! if you ppl will notice that ONLY the charm spell is
effected
>by CHARISMA!!!!........the ***"CHARM" LINE OF SPELLS
ONLY***!!!!>........
>
>

The problem of course being is that neither Stratics or EQVault are in
any
way affiliated with Verant. Neither have any 'inside' information that
guarantees that all information contained therein is accurate. For
example,
I would recommend reading EQVault's guide to jewelcraft. It is one of
the
remarkably worst pieces of prose I've ever had the privelidge to read.
It
make Hubbard's Battlefield Earth look like Ulysses. ;) Now, I'm not
saying
that charisma necessarily affects resists in any way shape or form, I
dont
have any data on the matter (and I've been playing eq since the begining
of
phase 3). If some people are experiencing a great deal fewer resists,
it's
entirely possible that there's an undocumented chr effect.

[snip]

Cheers,
Jude Morrigan
